titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Albemarle County (Va.) Records, circa 1744-1956, undated
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 1042636-1180991
titlepage.author: Callie Lou Freed

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: 64 boxes--60 found at Library of Virginia and 4 (1042636, 1042642, 1043214, 1141496) found at State Records Center--Library of Virginia, Archives Annex

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Albemarle County (Va.) Records, circa 1744-1956, undated. Local government records collection, Albemarle County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court records from Albemarle County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Albemarle County was named for William Anne Keppel, second earl of Albemarle and governor of the Virginia colony from 1737-1754. The county was formed from Goochland County in 1744, and part of Louisa County and certain islands in the Fluvanna River, now called the James, were added later.

All order books, except the first, and many loose papers, created between 1748 and 1781, were destroyed during the Revolutionary War by British general Banastre Tarleton's raid on Charlottesville in 1781.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Albemarle County (Va.) Records, circa 1744-1956, undated, consist of the following records series: Court Records (subfield series include Judgments, Criminal Records, Clerks' Records, Court Finance, Jury Records, Personal Documentation, Dockets and Chancery Records), County Administrative Records (subfield series include Board of Supervisors Records, Overseer of the Poor Records, Sheriffs' Records and Treasurer's Records), Road and Bridge Records, Land Records, Business Records, Tax and Fiscal Records, Fiduciary Records, Miscellaneous Records, Bonds/Commissions/Oaths, Marriage Records and Vital Statistics, Organization Records, Town Adminstrative Records, School Records, Election Records, Justice of the Peace Records, Health and Medical Records and Military and Pension Records. Some boxes contain UNPROCESSED records.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Albemarle County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia's web site.

Albemarle County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Accomack County Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Digital Collection available at Virginia Memory.
For more information and a listing of lost records localities see Lost Records research note.

scopecontent.p: Court Records: UNPROCESSED Judgments, 1871-1876, Transcript - judgment suit - Albemarle Oil and Gas Co. vs. T.P. Peyton, 1924, UNPROCESSED Commonwealth Causes, 1908-1910; Road and Bridge Records, 1794, 1933; Land Records: Maps - blueprints, UNPROCESSED Deeds, 1870; Business Records/Corporations/Partnerships: Unidentified plumber's ledgers, 1895-1897, Unidentified bank checkbook, 1886, Correspondence - Toothill Manufacturing Co., 1897; Tax and Fiscal Records, 1897.
Court Records: Judgments, Commonwealth Causes, Criminal Records, Executions, etc., 1805-1910; Tax and Fiscal Records, 1905-1906; Fiduciary Records, 1906, 1908. No chancery. UNPROCESSED.

Miscellaneous Records: Estray books, 1748-1854; Court Records: Transcripts of following Judgment suits Ludeman versus Dutar, 1921, King Lumber Company versus Faulconer, 1921, Admx. of Bowers versus Chesapeake and Ohio Railroad Company, 1917; Meyers Manufacturing Company versus King Lumber Company, 1915; Dun versus Chaloner, 1920; Exhibit - Deed, Southern Railway Company to Central Trust Company of New Yory, 1894; Witness attendance book, 1863-1890; Fee and Civil Records, 1937; Business Records: Samuel Lewis Account Book, 1839-1855; Racket Store Bank Book, 1929-1932
Court Records: Judgments and Dockets, Bonds/Commissions/Oaths, Land Records, Wills. Chancery pulled.
Court Records: Judgments, Bonds/Commissions/Oaths, Land Records. Chancery pulled.

Fiduciary Records: Appointments of Trustees and Letters of Administration; Court Records: Reports of Commissioners and Name Changes; Bonds; Business Records: Partnership Papers; Marriage Records and Vital Statistics: Marriage Contracts.
Court Records: Judgments, Road and Bridge Records, Tax and Fiscal Records. Chancery pulled.
Court Records: Judgments, Fiduciary Records, Organizational records, Bonds/Commissions/Oaths. Chancery pulled.

Agreement Report of Division, DB 64, p. 67; Amendment to the Constitution of By laws of Building Association, 1868,; Appointment of Trustee under Deed of Trust, 1907; Assignment of Bankrupt's Effects, 1867-1888; Bankruptcies recorded in Deed Book; Bonds; Contracts; Deed of Release, Deed of Trust, 1899; Deeds, 1874,1877; Boundaries, 1912; Extract of DB 123, p.463 (1902); Judgment, Condemnation 1907; Renunciation, 1862; Survey Reports; Law Orders substituting of Trustee, 1907-1914. All pulled from Albemarle Deeds.

CIVIL WAR ERA Box 5: Justice of the Peace Records: Constable's Records, 1858; Business Records: Contracts and Agreements, 1858-1866; Miscellaneous Records: Estray Papers, 1858-1968; Business Records: Fire Co. Papers, 1866; Health and Medical Records, 1863-1870; Military and Pension Records: Impressment Papers, 1864; Court Records: Jailer's Records, 1858-1870; Health and Medical: Lunacy Papers, 1858, 1868; Miscellaneous Papers, 1867; County Administrative Records: Overseers of the Poor, 1858-1871; Land Records: Petition for Exemption from Fence Law, 1866-1877.

Bonds/Oaths/Commissions: Commission of John M. White judge of 8th Judicial Circuit (1904); Certification of Mijacah Woods as Justice of the Peace (n.d.); Court Records: General District Court Docket, (1789); Court Records: Personal Documentation: certificate of character for Richard [Snow?] (1845); Court Records: Personal Documentation: Declarations of intent (1822-1852); Tax and Fiscal Records: Schedule of John Jordan's property (n.d.)

Court Records: Correspondence re: George S. Shackelford, attorney at law, 1880-1881; Letters related to incarceration of Daniel Johnson, 1907; Gilmer family genealogical charts; Organization Records: Catalogue of the Ellerslie Yearlings - Property of Arthur B. Hancock, 1916; All God's Children - pamphlet published by Albemarle Child Welfare Association, no date; Court Records: Copy of answer - Fluvanna County Chancery Cause, James Johnson vs. Nicholas Johnson, 1823; Judgments: Debt account - Colonel T. J. Randolph to William Jeffries, 1874; Deposition - unidentified Judgemnt suit; Court Records: Grand Jury Presentment, no date.

Fiduciary Records (estate), 1790-1807; County Adminstrative Records: Board of Supervisor Records: Road and Bridge Records, 1855, 1857; Land Records: 1834, 1845, 1855; Court Records: Judgments: Johnson vs. Admr of Hunter, 1816.
